    • Leader [390pts]

      • Elathain Ill-fated [145pts]

        Selections: Envenomed Bite, Talunsickle and Soulnet

        Categories: ORDER, AELF, IDONETH DEEPKIN, IONRACH, ISHARANN, HERO, SOULRENDER, ELATHAIN ILL-FATED, 9 or less wounds Leader, Leader, Unique

        Unit: Elathain Ill-fated, Unit Abilities: Envenomed Bite, Lurelight, Soulnet, Weapon: Envenomed Bite, Talunsickle and Soulnet


        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Elathain Ill-fated 6"584+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Envenomed Bite If the unmodified hit roll for an attack made with an Envenomed Bite is 6, that attack inflicts 1 mortal wound on the target and the attack sequence ends (do not make a wound or save roll).
        Lurelight At the end of your battleshock phase, pick 1 friendly NAMARTI unit wholly within 12" of this model, or pick a friendly ELATHAIN’S SOULRAD unit in which Tammael has been slain that is wholly within 12" of this model. If you picked a NAMARTI unit, roll a D3. Add 1 to the roll for each enemy model that was slain by wounds inflicted by this model’s Talúnsickle and Soulnet in the combat phase of the same turn, then return a number of slain models to that unit up to the value of the roll. If you picked ELATHAIN’S SOULRAD, return Tammael to that unit.
        Soulnet At the start of the combat phase, pick 1 enemy HERO within 3" of this model and roll a dice. Subtract 2 from the roll if that HERO is a MONSTER. On a 4+, you can re-roll hit rolls for attacks made with this model’s Talúnsickle and Soulnet that target that HERO in that combat phase
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Envenomed Bite Melee3"44+4+-1
        Talunsickle and Soulnet Melee2"23+3+-12

      • Isharann Soulscryer [140pts]

        Selections: Finger-claw, Scryfish Shoal

        Categories: HERO, ISHARANN, ORDER, PRIEST, SOULSCRYER, IDONETH DEEPKIN, 9 or less wounds Leader, Leader

        Unit: Isharann Soulscryer, Unit Abilities: Finder of Ways, Seeker of Souls , Weapon: Finger-claw, Scryfish Shoal


        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Isharann Soulscryer 6"576+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Finder of Ways Instead of setting up this unit on the battlefield, you can place it to one side and say that it is set up travelling the ethersea. If you do so, when you would set up another friendly IDONETH DEEPKIN unit, instead of setting up the unit, you can say that it is joining this model in the ethersea. Up to 2 units can join this model in this way. At the end of any of your movement phases, you can set up this model wholly within 6"of the edge of the battlefield and more than 9"from any enemy models; then set up any units that joined this model wholly within 6"of the edge of the battlefield, wholly within 12"of this model, and more than 9"from any enemy models.
        Seeker of Souls At the start of your charge phase, you can pick one enemy unit within 24"of this model that is visible to them. If you do so, you must add 3 to charge rolls for friendly IDONETH DEEPKIN units that are within 12"of that unit. However, the first model to be moved from each unit that receives this modifier must finish their charge move within ½"of that unit or their charge will fail.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Finger-claw Melee1"33+4+-1
        Scryfish Shoal Missile18"85+5+-1

      • Isharann Tidecaster [105pts]

        Selections: General - Isharann, Pelagic Staff

        Categories: ISHARANN, ORDER, HERO, TIDECASTER, WIZARD, IDONETH DEEPKIN, 9 or less wounds Leader, Leader, General

        Magic: Isharann Tidecaster, Spell: Arcane Bolt, Mystic Shield, Riptide, Unit: Isharann Tidecaster, Unit Abilities: Spirit Guardians, The Wide Ethersea ( General), Weapon: Pelagic Staff


        Magic Cast/UnbindSpells Known Ref
        Isharann Tidecaster 1/1Arcane Bolt, Mystic Shield, and Riptide
        Spell Casting ValueRangeDescription Ref
        Arcane Bolt 512"If successfully cast, at the start of any 1 phase before your next hero phase, you can pick 1 enemy unit within range and visible to the caster. That unit suffers 1 mortal wound. If that unit is within 3" of the caster, it suffers D3 mortal wounds instead of 1.
        Mystic Shield 512"If successfully cast, pick 1 friendly unit wholly within range and visible to the caster. Add 1 to save rolls for attacks that target that unit until your next hero phase.
        Riptide 718"If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 18"of the caster that is visible to them. Until your next hero phase, subtract 1 from hit rolls for that unit. In addition, at the start of your next hero phase the unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Isharann Tidecaster 6"576+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Spirit Guardians The first wound allocated to this model each turn is negated.
        The Wide Ethersea ( General) If this model is the general of your army, at the start of the first battle round you can declare that the Tides of Death table will be reversed. If you do so, the Ebb Tide ability is used in the first battle round, the High Tide ability is used in the second battle round, the Flood Tide ability is used in the third battle round, and the Low Tide ability is used in the fourth battle round. Then the four Tides of Death steps are repeated in reverse order, starting with Ebb Tide.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Pelagic Staff Melee1"23+3+-D3

      • Gotrek Gurnisson [435pts]

        Selections: Zangrom-Thaz

        Categories: HERO, ORDER, Other

        Unit: Gotrek Gurnisson, Unit Abilities: Avatar of Grimnir, Krag Blackhammer’s Master Rune, Shoulder Plate of Edassa, Unstoppable Battle Fury, Weapon: Zangrom-Thaz


        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Gotrek Gurnisson 4"8104+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Avatar of Grimnir If the damage inflicted by an attack, spell or ability that targets or affects this model is greater than 1, change it to 1. In addition, if a spell or ability would slay this model, this model suffers 1 mortal wound instead. However, if this model is included in your army, it cannot be set up in reserve (it must be set up on the battlefield), and you cannot use spells or abilities on this model that would allow you to set it up again after the battle has begun.
        Krag Blackhammer’s Master Rune You can re-roll hit and wound rolls for attacks made by this model. In addition, if the unmodified hit roll for an attack made by this model is 6, that attack inflicts D6 mortal wounds on the target in addition to any normal damage.
        Shoulder Plate of Edassa Roll a dice each time you allocate a wound or mortal wound to this model. On a 3+, that wound or mortal wound is negated.
        Unstoppable Battle Fury At the end of the combat phase, if this model is within 3" of an enemy unit, this model can fight again.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Zangrom-Thaz Melee1"63+3+-23

    • Allegiance

      • Allegiance

        Categories: Allegiance

        • Idoneth Deepkin

          Selections: Forgotten Nightmares, Isharann Rituals, Tides of Death

          Categories: IDONETH DEEPKIN

          Battalion Abilities: Isharann Rituals, Battle Trait: Forgotten Nightmares, Isharann Rituals: Ritual of Erosion, Ritual of Rousing, Ritual of the Tempest, Tides of Death: -, 1. Low Tide, 2. Flooding Tide, 3. High Tide, 4. Ebbing Tide


        Battalion Abilities Battalion Ability Details Ref
        Isharann Rituals ISHARANN HEROES from an Idoneth Deepkin army can perform the following Isharann rituals in your hero phase. A maximum of one Isharann ritual can be performed in each hero phase. In order to perform a ritual, at the start of your hero phase, say which ritual is being performed and then pick one ISHARANN HERO from your army that is more than 9" from any enemy models. Then roll 2D6. Add 1 to the roll if the HERO performing the ritual is within 1" of a Gloomtide Shipwreck, and add a further 1 to the roll if they are a PRIEST. In addition, add 1 to the roll for each other friendly ISHARANN HERO that is within 3" of the model performing the ritual (add 2 instead for each HERO within 3" that is a PRIEST). On a 10+ the ritual is successfully performed. On any other result, the ritual fails and nothing happens.
        Battle Trait Battle Trait Details Ref
        Forgotten Nightmares Missile weapons can only be used to target an Idoneth Deepkin with this battle trait if it is the closest visible enemy unit
        Isharann Rituals Effect Ref
        Ritual of Erosion Until your next hero phase, enemy units do not receive any benefit for being in cover.
        Ritual of Rousing Heal 1 wound allocated to each friendly EIDOLON on the battlefield. In addition, you can re-roll failed hit rolls and casting rolls for friendly EIDOLONS until your next hero phase.
        Ritual of the Tempest Until your next hero phase, enemy models cannot fly.
        Tides of Death TurnEffect Ref
        - IDONETH DEEPKIN units with this battle trait have a different Tides of Death ability each battle round, as shown on the Tides of Death table below.
        1. Low Tide 1/5In this battle round, all units with the Tides of Death battle trait are treated as being in cover
        2. Flooding Tide 2/6In this battle round, all units with the Tides of Death battle trait that run can still either shoot or charge in the same turn (but not both).
        3. High Tide 3/7In this battle round, the strike-first effect applies to units with the Tides of Death battle trait. Battletome: Idoneth Deepkin Errata, July 2021 p1
        4. Ebbing Tide 4/8In this battle round, all units with the Tides of Death battle trait that retreat can still either shoot or charge in the same turn (but not both).

        Selections: 2000 Points - Battlehost

        Categories: Game Options, Battlehost

      • Grand Strategy

        Selections: Dominating Presence

        Categories: Game Options, Grand Strategy

        Grand Strategy: Dominating Presence


        Grand Strategy Description Ref
        Dominating Presence When the battle ends, you complete this grand strategy if there are more units from your starting army on the battlefield than there are units from your opponent's starting army on the battlefield.
